page.title: 11TRADITIONS.
page.content: {SKILLS.}Because of the remote nature of our area, and a relatively unchanging pattern of life, many local traditions have survived. Some of these are inherited skills which are unlikely to continue to the next generation since the skills themselves are not being practised. These include ploughing with horses,thatching and sowing fields by hand. Skills which have endured are dairy products made by hand,hand-milking,Cornish pasty making,bee-keeping,spinning,welding and Cornish stone-hedging. {DIALECT WORDS.}Local people grew up with many dialect words but only use them with intimates. As the words are only spoken, no-one is sure of their correct spelling and the absence of a written record makes their survival uncertain.The following table gives some indication of their meanings.
